title: DNA extraction from whole blood using simple salting out procedure
title_html: DNA extraction from whole blood using simple salting out procedure

protocol.title: DNA extraction from whole blood using simple salting out procedure

source.description: If you use FROZEN blood, start with step-case 'FROZEN blood'. If FRESH blood is used, select step-case 'FRESH blood'.
Decant the blood sample into 50 ml conical tube.

source.body: Note: Blood solution becomes transparent.

If you continue with processing "Nuclei lysis, day 1", then continue after this step with Nuclei lysis (step 13) and leave pellet in 50ml conical tube.

and close the tube tightly. Pipette up and down to resuspend the pellet (cleans up the nuclei pellet from additional RBCs and allows for storage in small tubes).

source.body:
The total volume is about 3370 plus the volume of the pellet for the nuclei lysis.
If 70ul of 10mg/ml proteinase K is added, it results in a dilution of ~1:50, which will be a final proteinase K concentration of 200ug/ml.

source.description: Mix by gently swirling tube.

Incubate
in water bath at
.

source.body: Temperature is at 55C as proteinase K is resistant to denaturation by heat and will continue to function as long as the temperature/concentration is not too high, wherease most mucleases are denatureated at this temparature.

of
to the tubes.
Close caps tightly and shake vigorously.

source.body: Note: Very important to shake thoroughly at this step to precipitate proteins.

While centrifuging, label 2x 15ml conical tubes per sample.

source.body: Note: The supernatant contains the DNA.

source.description: Transfer supernatant to next 15 ml conical tube.

Add equal volume of ice-cold isopropanol (usually about
).
Invert tubes several times and DNA will precipitate.

source.body: Note: You should be able to see white strings (this is the DNA!).

Transfer samples into barcode tubes and log into DNA bank.

In the morning take out tubes of blood from the
freezer. Record ID numbers and put in fridge (
) to thaw until later in the afternoon.
Once blood has thawed, invert several times or place on rotator for a couple of minutes.

materials.name: EDTA 500 mM Solution pH 8.0 ULTROL® Grade

description: The purpose of this protocol is high-molecular weight DNA extraction from whole blood for genetic analyses, including no amplification long-range sequencing.
